title: Traveler's Journey
text: Thee anon knoweth yond thee w're obviously right, encount'ring a less'r goodyear (which is way too pow'rful f'r the h'ro to dudgeon coequal though thee senseth an int'resting aura
the h'ro plays his parteth and taketh a standeth in front of the goodyear only to receiveth his stout handeth t'rn in a did split second. The apprentice tries to holdeth of the
goodyear with confidence, that gent is forsooth m're pow'rful than the h'ro (makes thee wond'r..).
knowing the two of those folk wouldst not survive the square and the valorous humor thou art in thee decideth to dispose of the monst'r which leadeth to thy disappearance - in
'rd'r to keepeth thy emanating identity safeguard'd.
